title.narrative: Communicating and Disseminating the Results of the Innovative Veterinary Solutions for Antimicrobial Resistance Program
Communiquer et diffuser les résultats de l’initiative Solutions vétérinaires innovatrices pour la résistance aux antimicrobiens

description.narrative:
Ce projet appuie la gestion des besoins en communication de l’initiative Solutions vétérinaires innovatrices pour la résistance aux antimicrobiens (InnoVet-AMR), notamment l’image de marque, la sensibilisation et les événements spéciaux.
InnoVet-AMR est un partenariat d’une valeur de 27,9 millions $ CAD entre le Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) du Royaume-Uni et le CRDI. L’initiative soutient la recherche permettant de dégager des solutions novatrices en médecine vétérinaire, y compris des vaccins, pour réduire l’utilisation d’antimicrobiens dans les exploitations d’élevage et d’aquaculture dans les pays à revenu faible et moyen. InnoVet-AMR permettra également l’établissement de partenariats efficaces pour coordonner la découverte, la mise au point et la distribution durable de ces solutions vétérinaires innovatrices.

The Innovative Veterinary Solutions for Antimicrobial Resistance (InnoVet-AMR) program is a CAD 27.9 million partnership between the UK’s Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) and Canada’s International Development Research Centre (IDRC). Through this initiative, IDRC and DHSC will support research to identify innovative veterinary solutions, including vaccines, to reduce the use of antimicrobials in livestock and aquaculture operations in Low and Middle Income Countries. InnoVet-AMR will also build effective partnerships to coordinate discovery, development and sustainable delivery of these innovative veterinary solutions.
This Research Support Project will support the management of the InnoVet-AMR initiative’s communications needs including the branding, outreach, and special events activities. The funds associated with this RSP will cover costs associated with developing and disseminating communications products, including project profiles and project updates to communicate progress, outputs, and early results and outcome stories. Consultants may be hired, when justified, to aid with the development of these products to effectively communicate results to target audiences. This RSP will also support the program’s translation expenses.
